content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron gear wheel production line at position around (16.0, 71.0) to (21.5, 73.5)  
Consists of the following connected entities forming a production chain for iron gear wheels:  
- Burner mining drill at position (16.0, 71.0) extracting iron ore, currently fueled with coal  
- Stone furnace at position (17.0, 73.0) smelting iron ore into iron plates, fueled and active  
- Burner inserters at positions (17.5, 71.5), (19.5, 73.5), and (23.5, 73.5), intended to transfer items between mining drill, furnace, assembling machine, and chest; currently out of fuel and unable to operate properly  
- Wooden chest at position (18.5, 73.5) collecting iron gear wheels  
- Assembling machine 2 at position (21.5, 73.5) set to craft iron gear wheels from iron plates; not receiving power and thus inactive  
- Small electric poles at positions (18.5, 72.5), (18.5, 75.5), and (21.5, 75.5) intended to provide electricity connections; power network appears incomplete or insufficient to energize the assembler and inserters  

This structure integrates mining, smelting, assembling, and storage within a compact area, connected by inserters and powered by electric poles. However, inserters lack fuel and the assembling machine is not powered, causing production to halt.

ERROR TIPS

### Errors related to burner inserters running out of fuel  
- Burner inserters require fuel (coal) to operate; failure to insert coal into burner inserters results in them being unable to transfer items.  
- Always ensure sufficient coal is harvested and inserted into burner inserters to keep them operational.  
- Consider switching to electric inserters powered by electricity to avoid fuel dependency and simplify logistics.

### Errors inserting coal into burner inserters despite having coal in inventory  
- Repeated failures to insert coal into burner inserters indicate possible timing or inventory synchronization issues.  
- Verify that the agent’s inventory is updated and that coal is physically available before attempting insertion.  
- Avoid attempting to insert more coal than the inserter can hold or when it is already full.

### Errors related to assembling machine not receiving power despite electric poles placed  
- Assembling machine 2 reports zero energy and NO_POWER status even after connecting to power poles.  
- Check that electric poles form a continuous power network with sufficient coverage and correct placement to energize all connected entities.  
- Confirm that poles are properly connected and powered by a power source (e.g., steam engine or solar panel).  
- Consider placing additional poles or repositioning existing ones to ensure full coverage of the assembling machine and inserters.

### Errors due to attempting to insert items (coal, iron ore) not present in inventory  
- Several errors occurred when trying to insert coal or iron ore that was not available in the agent’s inventory.  
- Always verify inventory contents before insertion attempts to avoid exceptions.  
- Implement checks or conditional logic to skip insertion if the required item is missing.

### General tips to mitigate fuel and power related errors  
- Maintain a steady supply of coal by harvesting and distributing it efficiently to all burner entities.  
- Transition to electric inserters and mining drills when possible to reduce fuel management complexity.  
- Regularly verify power network connectivity and energy levels of electric entities to prevent production stoppages.  
- Monitor entity statuses and warnings (e.g., "out of fuel", "not receiving electricity") to quickly identify and address operational issues.

NAMESPACE

No user-defined functions have been defined in the current steps.
